a.data-title:
Titan Family,

Good afternoon. As we had anticipated, but certainly didn’t want, we will be closed for the remainder of the school year. This is even hard to write knowing of our amazing senior class, who have accomplished and grown so much over the past four years. They have overcome challenges and negativity, have risen above and will continue to do great things for our world.
.
We have been meeting (virtually) as a facultustaff, arts teachers, and administration to plan for the future, keeping in mind the health and safety of our broader Tuacahn Family. We are working through graduation options and ways to highlight our seniors.
.
Next week, our Booster parents will be delivering THSA yard signs for all senior students, along with a care package. They are brainstorming other ways to creatively celebrate our seniors. We appreciate their engagement and leadership through this process. Additionally we have sent a survey to our seniors, for creative ideas surrounding a virtual graduation. .
We are working through plans for graduation. We have put together a staff committee and should have more information by early next week. While we do want to celebrate, our first concern is the safety and health of our community. Thank you for your continued trust and patience with this unknown health pandemic.
.
We will do our online school through May 8th. Please stay engaged throughout the process. .
With love and admiration,
.
Drew

a.span: Titan Family, Good afternoon. As we had anticipat

img.alt:
Titan Family,
Good afternoon. As we had anticipated, but certainly didn’t want, we will be closed for the remainder of the school year. This is even hard to write knowing of our amazing senior class, who have accomplished and grown so much over the past four years. They have overcome challenges and negativity, have risen above and will continue to do great things for our world. . We have been meeting (virtually) as a facultustaff, arts teachers, and administration to plan for the future, keeping in mind the health and safety of our broader Tuacahn Family. We are working through graduation options and ways to highlight our seniors. . Next week, our Booster parents will be delivering THSA yard signs for all senior students, along with a care package. They are brainstorming other ways to creatively celebrate our seniors. We appreciate their engagement and leadership through this process. Additionally we have sent a survey to our seniors, for creative ideas surrounding a virtual graduation. . We are working through plans for graduation. We have put together a staff committee and should have more information by early next week. While we do want to celebrate, our first concern is the safety and health of our community. Thank you for your continued trust and patience with this unknown health pandemic. . We will do our online school through May 8th. Please stay engaged throughout the process. . With love and admiration, . Drew

a.data-title:
April 11, 2020
Titan Family,

This has been a whirlwind few weeks. I’m sure that like me and my family, you are ready to get back to school, get back to performances, and most importantly, get back to graduation and the celebration of our amazing seniors. Each Friday our faculstaff family gets on a Zoom call to check-in. We miss each other, miss knowing about our lives, our hopes and our dreams. We feed off of this energy and collaboration. Our Zoom call is one of the highlights of my week.
I am hopeful that we will get more direction from our Governor and State Superintendent this coming week. The feeling of the unknown is hard. It requires all of us to have contingency plans and back ups. Throughout this health crisis, it is the artists who have helped us laugh, cry, connect and often heal. At THSA, we are a group of artists, poised to make an impact on our world, to help our community through this and future crises. Artists are able to shift, to create a new normal, to adapt better than any other group. THIS is why an arts education is so vital. I have recently watched the art community bring the world through song, dance, spoken word and art; all in different ways than had been thought of 2 months ago. Watching the cast of Hamilton perform through Zoom, Nashville musicians perform a Beatles cover tune - all while in isolation in their homes. I’m in awe.
We are striving to adapt in this crisis as a school - to provide a relevant education, a memorable year, and most importantly a celebration of our students work and achievements - most notable our seniors. Last night our Sterling Scholars were honored via livestream YouTube for being leaders at Tuacahn (Ambrie, Naji Runs Through, Ike, Eric, Makelle, Cassidy, Rachel, Zariah, Gaylen). We want to congratulate them on this accomplishment, for working hard all year through this adversity to rise above. We also want to congratulate our Valedictorian and Salutatorian, Eric and Emme. What an accomplishment. ... finish on our Covid-19 Updates Google Page. ❤️

It requires all of us to have contingency plans and back ups. Throughout this health crisis, it is the artists who have helped us laugh, cry, connect and often heal. At THSA, we are a group of artists, poised to make an impact on our world, to help our community through this and future crises. Artists are able to shift, to create a new normal, to adapt better than any other group. THIS is why an arts education is so vital. div.h2: We engage and cultivate the creative mind, while laying the foundation for a lifelong love of learning and success.

div.h4: Our approach at Tuacahn High SCHOOL for the ARTS
div.p: We provide a holistic and dynamic educational curriculum. Our students spend their days immersed in both academics and art. They’re building their skills to become creative thinkers in any discipline with perseverance towards curiosity and new ideas. Through a constant cycle of collaboration, work ethic, self-discipline, fortitude, and grit, students are more agile for any university program or artistic endeavor.

div.h2: Parents, looking for the right school?

div.style: background-repeat: no-repeat; margin-top: 75px; margin-bottom: 30px; background-size: contain;

div.h2: Give your student the advantage of an arts education and help them soar into adulthood.

ul.li: Cultivates well-rounded people ready for the world
Increases academic achievement in all areas
Promotes civic engagement and equitable opportunity
Connects students more deeply to the world and opens them to new ways of seeing

div.a: learn about our campus in the canyon

div.style: background-repeat: no-repeat; margin-top: 90px; margin-bottom: 90px; background-size: contain;

div.h2: When it comes to success, educational experience is everything.
div.p: Our aim is to stimulate our students’ creativity and inspire new thoughts while providing an educational experience that appeals to any university.

div.h3: Utah's Premiere Public, Non-Tuition School for the Arts
